clinical_study.brief_title: 4D Medical X-ray Velocimetry for Bronchoscopic Lung Volume Reduction Targeting
clinical_study.official_title: 4DXV for Targeting in Bronchoscopic Lung Volume Reduction

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the utility of 4D Medical's X-ray Velocimetry (XV) imaging analysis software for the detection of hyperinflation, and compare endobronchial valve placement outcomes with predictive indices obtained utilizing this technique.

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of residual volume over functional residual capacity by 4DXV
primary_outcome.description: We will compare an XV hyperinflation index to traditional pulmonary function tests (PFTs) and outcomes

primary_outcome.measure: Expiratory Time Constants vs Fissure Completeness
primary_outcome.description: We will examine the correlation between lobar expiratory time constants and fissure completeness by StratX

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Saint George Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ)
secondary_outcome.description: We will compare SGRQs pre and post valve placement to hyperinflative indices by 4D XV

intervention.description: X-ray velocimetry uses fluoroscopy to quantify local ventilation in the lung.

study_pop.textblock: Adults with symptomatic emphysema with hyperinflation and no conflating lung diseases or pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
- CT chest and PFTs within the last two years
- Age over 18
- COPD with emphysema
- Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) 3 - 4 classification OR modified Medical Research Council (mMRC) score of 2 or greater.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Presence of an additional pulmonary disease beyond COPD
- Inability to raise arms above 90 degrees as required for fluoroscopy

responsible_party.investigator_title: Fellow/Assistant Professor of Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine
